description: Black holes are regions of spacetime where gravity is so strong that nothing, not even light, can escape from them. They are formed by the collapse of massive stars and have captivated scientists and the public for decades. name: gravitational pull

description: Gravitational pull is the force of attraction between masses, which can be so strong in black holes that it warps spacetime and prevents even light from escaping. name: Existence of Black Holes
